result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett I. Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Garrett I. Hodges is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Garrett I. Hodges was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Garrett I. Hodges in court, in custody with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed in 15 CF 514, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2 in 15 CF 514, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 in 15 CF 514 dismissed, 16 CM 27 dismissed, 15 FO 783 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, 40 days jail w/Huber to commence 5/1/16 at 7:00 P.M., $528.00 costs, $1,012.00 Restitution, AODA and comply, DNA Sample, absolute sobriety, psychological eval and comply,

Cases called: 15CF514 & 15CM725,  Defendant, Garrett I. Hodges, appeared in custody with Atty. Benavides special for today. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Current address given: 314 W Cook, Portage. 15CM725 dismissed. County ordinance to go with felony case.  $2,000 recog. bond  with felony conds & no contact A.H. or residence, no contact C.F. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
